page.title: 13LOCAL SCHOOLS
page.content: {OUR LADY'S INFANT AND JUNIOR SCHOOLS } were named after the Catholic Church situated in the eastern part of Wellingborough. The Junior school is about 21 years old and now has 250 children attending it. The present headmaster has been there for 8 years.The school has one floor level and 8 classes. Children who attend the school come from a wide area. Most of them transfer to St. Mary's Middle School in Northampton at the age of 11. {RUSKIN INFANT SCHOOL}is 17 years old and has 150 children on roll at present. The age range is 5-7. There are a further 52 children aged between 3 and 5 in a nursery unit. There are 8 teachers altogether, including the headmistress. The best feature of the school is the big classroom windows. Pupils transfer to Ruskin Junior.
